Research Experience

Visiting Research Assistant, Illinois Augmented Listening Laboratory, University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign, IL, 2018–present
Professor: Andrew Singer
Project: Overdetermined Multimicrophone Array Processing: Built two datasets of multichannel impulse responses using large (100+) microphone arrays to determine how well beamforming, blind source separation, and localization scale with number of microphones. Designed and 3D printed uniform linear array and uniform circular array microphone stands. Used logarithmic sine sweeps and various clips from the VCTK Corpus as source signals.

Undergraduate Research Assistant, Oberlin College, Oberlin, OH, 2017
Professor: Jason Stalnaker
Project: Laser interferometric characterization for vibrating speaker system: Designed and wrote code for an experiment to measure the frequency response of a JBL LSR305 studio monitor using Michelson-type laser interferometry.

Professor: John Scofield
Project: Configuring a GPIB-controlled monochromator for Hα shift in atomic hydrogen & deuterium: Wrote a LabVIEW program to operate a scanning monochromator with a PC via IEEE-488 bus specification for the purpose of observing the Balmer series lines in atomic hydrogen and deuterium. The program was later used in the laboratory section of Physics 212: Modern Physics.

Visiting Engineering Assistant, Fermi National Accelerator Laboratory, Batavia, IL, 2017
Supervisor: Yun He
Project: Updating Technical Design Handbook for Neutrinos at the Main Injector (NuMI) Facility: Consolidated and compiled various engineering documents regarding the technical design, upgrades, and operation of the NuMI facility at Fermilab. Helped create the following webpage for easy reference: https://web.fnal.gov/project/TargetSystems/NuMI/SitePages/Home.aspx.
